segment.source: This section provides direction in planning and designing a Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) infrastructure and addresses the following tasks:
segment.target: This section provides direction in planning and designing a Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) infrastructure and addresses the following tasks:

segment.source: Describes how to define the project scope by defining the end users, determining the MED-V images to be managed, determining the organization’s service level expectations, and validating with the business.
segment.target: Describes how to define the project scope by defining the end users, determining the MED-V images to be managed, determining the organization’s service level expectations, and validating with the business.

segment.source: Identify the Number of MED-V Instances
segment.target: Identify the Number of MED-V Instances

segment.source: Describes how to identify the number of MED-V instances required.
segment.target: Describes how to identify the number of MED-V instances required.

segment.source: Describes how to design the server for each MED-V instance, the SQL Server database, and the management console.
segment.target: Describes how to design the server for each MED-V instance, the SQL Server database, and the management console.

segment.source: Describes the steps required in designing the MED-V image repositories.
segment.target: Describes the steps required in designing the MED-V image repositories.
